reuo.resources.io

Class IndexedLoader<E extends Entry,R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • reuo.resources.io.Loader<R>
      • reuo.resources.io.IndexedLoader<E,R>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of entries
    R - the type of the resources
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Integer>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FragmentIndexedLoader, MemoryIndexedLoader, StoredIndexedLoader

    public abstract class IndexedLoader<E extends Entry,R>
extends Loader<R>
implements Iterable<Integer>
    A Loader that has an index. The index is a set of entries that describe the Resources.

    Entries

    Entries describe resources and share the same identifier. This index typically describes the where the resource is, but may include other meta-information. Any entry may be invalid in the index. The identifiers for entries may be sparse because some entries may be invalid. This class implements Iterable which provides an iterator for valid entry identifiers.

    Stored and Generated Indexes

    An index may exist from a data source or generated in memory. Generated indexes are typically small, while indexes from data sources are large and usually mapped to a file.
    Author:
    Kristopher Ives
    See Also:
    MemoryIndexedLoader, StoredIndexedLoader

        public abstract E getEntry(int id)

      • iterator

        public Iterator<Integer> iterator()
        Gets an iteration of the valid entry identifiers in the index. Implementing classes may override this, but by default this will iterate from 0 to Loader.getCapacity() only returning valid entries.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface Iterable<Integer>
